pr_title: log all admin actions, remove some admin permissions, see what tests …

timeline.message: log all admin actions, remove some admin permissions, see what tests fail

timeline.bodyText: You could change this to if (principal instanceof User) {. If present, I'm guessing the principal must always be a User, but even so, it would give you more confidence for the next line where you cast it.
timeline.author: coverbeck

timeline.bodyText: You shouldn't need to cast u to User -- I think it should already be one.
timeline.author: coverbeck

replies.bodyText: Not sure why, but doesn't work for some reason. I copied this from elsewhere in the file
replies.author: NatalieEO

replies.bodyText:
You're right, interesting. I looked at it briefly. I think it's because the method parameter shouldn't be Entry,  but a generic. Like EntryVersionHelper does it:
public interface EntryVersionHelper<T extends Entry<T, U>, U extends Version, W extends EntryDAO<T>>
...
    default T filterContainersForHiddenTags(T entry) {

But this pattern is all over the file and there are lots of implementations of this interface, so not worth changing for this PR.
replies.author: coverbeck

timeline.bodyText: Comment two lines up implies this is a renderer; it's not.
timeline.author: coverbeck

timeline.bodyText: A little JavaDoc explaining what this does would be nice.
timeline.author: coverbeck

timeline.bodyText:
Should this be a ContainerRequestFilter instead? I think the way you have it now it's logging the request when it's sending the response. Ideally you want to log the request right when it comes in. It's a stretch, but if some admin request request crashed the server before the response could be sent, nothing would be logged.
You need for the principal to have been set though, or it won't work, so you'll have to see if it's feasible.
timeline.author: coverbeck
